CustomStateSet.summary: The CustomStateSet interface of the Document Object Model stores a list of states for an autonomous custom element, and allows states to be added and removed from the set.

remarks.para: The interface can be used to expose the internal states of a custom element, allowing them to be used in CSS selectors by code that uses the element.

CustomStateSetAdd.summary: The add method of the interface adds value representing a custom state to the CustomStateSet.

remarks.para: Custom elements with a specific state can be selected using the :state() pseudo-class, specifying the desired state as an argument.

CustomStateSetClear.summary: The clear() method of the interface removes all elements from the CustomStateSet object.

CustomStateSetDelete.summary: The delete() method of the interface deletes a single value from the CustomStateSet.
CustomStateSetDelete.returns: Returns true if value was in the CustomStateSet; otherwise false.

CustomStateSetEntries.summary: The entries method of the interface returns a new iterator object, containing an array of [value,value] for each element in the CustomStateSet.
CustomStateSetEntries.returns: A new iterator object that contains an array of [value, value] for each element in the CustomStateSet, in insertion order.

CustomStateSetForEach.summary: The forEach() method of the interface executes a provided function for each value in the CustomStateSet object.

CustomStateSetHas.summary: The has() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Boolean")}} asserting whether an element is present with the given value.
CustomStateSetHas.returns: A , true if value exists in the CustomStateSet.

CustomStateSetKeys.summary: The keys() method of the interface is an alias for .
CustomStateSetKeys.returns: A new iterator object containing the values for each element in the given CustomStateSet, in insertion order.

CustomStateSetSize.summary: The size property of the interface returns the number of values in the CustomStateSet.
CustomStateSetSize.value: An integer indicating how many properties the CustomStateSet has.

CustomStateSetValues.summary: The values() method of the interface returns a new iterator object that yields the values for each element in the CustomStateSet object in insertion order.
CustomStateSetValues.returns: A new iterator object containing the values for each element in the given CustomStateSet, in insertion order.
